Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class TypedFrameAllocator< T >

A frame-based allocator compatible with std containers.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ TypedFrameAllocator()

template<typename T >
TypedFrameAllocator< T >::TypedFrameAllocator ( void *  pBuffer,
size_t  size 
)

Constructor.

Parameters
pBufferBuffer from which allocations are made
sizeSize of the buffer in bytes (must be at least ALIGNMENT bytes)
Note
In the Debug configuration, the bytes in the buffer are set to 0xDD

◆ ~TypedFrameAllocator()

template<typename T >
TypedFrameAllocator< T >::~TypedFrameAllocator ( )
default

Destructor.

Note
In the Debug configuration, the bytes in the buffer are set to 0xDD before destruction

Member Function Documentation

◆ allocate()

template<typename T >
T* TypedFrameAllocator< T >::allocate ( size_t  size)

Allocates uninitialized storage.

std::bad_alloc is thrown if the allocation failed.

Parameters
sizeNumber of bytes to allocate
Returns
Allocated memory, or nullptr0 if the space could not be allocated
Note
In the Debug configuration, the allocated bytes are initialized to 0xCD

◆ mark()

template<typename T >
Frame TypedFrameAllocator< T >::mark ( ) const

Marks the start of a frame.

Returns
The mark for use with release()

◆ release()

template<typename T >
void TypedFrameAllocator< T >::release ( Frame  frame)

Deallocates all memory allocated in the specified frame.

Note
In the Debug configuration, the released bytes are set to 0xDD
